alert.note: Alert for Morris; Somerset (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 13 at 3:40AM EDT until September 13 at 6:15AM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 445 AM EDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of northern New Jersey...including the following counties...Morris and Somerset. * WHEN...Until 445 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 339 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly across portions of the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Morristown, Madison, Florham Park, East Hanover, Morris Plains, Mendham, Mountain Lakes, Peapack And Gladstone, Far Hills, Basking Ridge, Millington, and Parsippany. - This includes the following highways... Interstate 80 in New Jersey between mile markers 39 and 43. Interstate 287 in New Jersey between mile markers 23 and 41. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
